code: library(DIGCLASS) library(readr)  isco_csv <- "ISCO08,ISCO88 0110,0110 0210,0110 0310,0110 0100,0110 0200,0110 0300,0110 1000,1000 1100,1100 1110,1100 1111,1110" isco_ready <- read_csv(isco_csv, col_types = list(.default = col_double())) isco_ready$ISCO08 <- repair_isco(isco_ready$ISCO08) #> ! title: A package to translate between occupational classes in R. Currently translate ISCO68/88/08 to dozens of occupational classes
text: DIGCLASS R package aims make translation occupational social classes easy comprehensive. facilitates translation International Standard Classification Occupations (ISCO) 1968, 1988 2008 wide range social class schemes. package work progress implemented currently translations: ISCO68 ISCO88 ISCO68 ISCO08 ISCO68 SIOPS ISCO68 ISEI ISCO68 EGP ISCO68 EGP-MP ISCO68 EGP11 ISCO68 EGP11-MP ISCO88 ISEI ISCO88 SIOPS ISCO88 MPS88 ISCO88 EGP ISCO88 EGP-MP ISCO88 EGP11 ISCO88 EGP11-MP ISCO88 OESCH16 ISCO88 ISCO88COM ISCO88 ISCO08 ISCO88 ISCO68 ISCO88COM ESEC - ISCO88COM must 3 digits ISCO88COM ESEC-MP - ISCO88COM must 3 digits ISCO88COM MSEC - ISCO88COM must 3 digits ISCO08 ISCO88 ISCO08 ISEI ISCO08 SIOPS ISCO08 OESCH16 ISCO08 ESEC - ISCO08 must 3 digits ISCO08 ESEC - ISCO08 must 2 digits ISCO08 ESEC-MP - ISCO08 must 3 digits ISCO08 MSEC - ISCO08 must 3 digits ISCO08 Microclasses Translation major/submajor/minor/unit groups ISCO68, ISCO88 ISCO08 Repair ISCO variables

title: Swap ISCO08/ISCO88/ISCO88 between 1, 2, 3 and 4 digit groups — isco08_swap
text: Note translate using isco*_swap need provide arguments. first one specifies current number digits input variable. variable 4-digit occupations, 4. want translate 4-digit occupations 3-digits arguments = 4 = 3. See argument description possible values. well examples works. function accept 4 digit codes 4 digits. means 3-digit code 131 1310. codes 4 digits, even though code represented 3-digits (1310, 1320, etc..) Note translation can done higher smaller digits (4 3, 3 2, 3 1) never way around (1 2, 2 3, 3 4). ISCO68 might return NAs depending occupation code 4 digits groups 0000 1000. translation 4 digit codes 1 digit codes within groups return NA major groups. See ILO website: https://www.ilo.org/public/english/bureau/stat/isco/isco68/major.htm.

text: MP ESEC-MPstands Managers Professionals. logic used build like : occupations ESEC digit 1 ISCO 1-digit 0 1 subordinates, high manager occupations ESEC digit 1 self-employed 1 employee, high manager occupations ESEC digit 1 1-digit ISCO higher 1 either employee self-employed subordinates, high professional occupations ESEC digit 2 ISCO 1-digit 0 1 subordinates, lower manager occupations ESEC digit 2 self-employed 1 employee, lower manager occupations ESEC digit 2 1-digit ISCO higher 1 either employee self-employed subordinates, lower professional translation created Stata file shared Oscar Smallenbroek called "ESEC-MP.". info, please contact author. function accept 3 digit codes 4 digits. means 3-digit code 131 1310. codes 4 digits, even though code represented 3-digits (1310, 1320, etc..) code: isco08_to_msec(x, is_supervisor, self_employed, n_employees, label = FALSE)

title: Translate 3-digit ISCO08 to MSEC — isco08_to_msec
text: x character vector 3-digit ISCO08 codes. Even though 3-digit, instead 130, code 1300, 3-digit version ISCO. is_supervisor numeric vector indicating whether individual supervisor (1, e.g. responsible employees) (0). self_employed numeric vector indicating whether individual self-employed (1) (0). n_employees numeric vector indicating number employees individual. label logical value indicating whether return labels translated MSEC codes (default FALSE).

title: Translate 3-digit ISCO08 to MSEC — isco08_to_msec
text: character vector MSEC codes.

title: Translate 3-digit ISCO08 to MSEC — isco08_to_msec
text: translation created document "Allocation rules ISCO-08 ISCO-88 (COM) 3-digit codes ESEG-Revised" Oscar Smallenbroek, Florian Hertel Carlo Barone. info, please contact authors. Although originally called ESEG-Revised, class schema formally called MSEC. function accept 3-digit codes 4 digits. means 3-digit code 131 1310. codes 4 digits, even though code represented 3 digits (1310, 1230, etc..)

title: Translate 3-digit ISCO08 to MSEC — isco08_to_msec
code: library(dplyr)  # convert to three digits ess$isco08_three <- isco08_swap(ess$isco08, from = 4, to = 3)  # Using the full method ess %>%   transmute(     msec_label = isco08_to_msec(       isco08_three,       is_supervisor,       self_employed,       emplno,       label = TRUE     ),     msec = isco08_to_msec(       isco08_three,       is_supervisor,       self_employed,       emplno,       label = FALSE     )   ) #> # A tibble: 56,752 × 2 #>    msec_label                                      msec  #>    <chr>                                           <chr> #>  1 Lower Management Employees                      14    #>  2 General Clerks                                  51    #>  3 Higher Management Employees                     13    #>  4 Primary and Secondary Education Professionals   25    #>  5 Skilled Labor Supervisors                       60    #>  6 Personal Care Employees                         53    #>  7 NA                                              NA    #>  8 Higher Management Employees                     13    #>  9 Professionals N.E.C. (Not Elsewhere Classified) 20    #> 10 Social Professionals                            24    #> # ℹ 56,742 more rows

title: Translate ISCO68 to EGP11-MP — isco68_to_egp11_mp
text: EGP11-MP class schema similar EGP11 reassigns managers professionals (ISCO68 codes 1 2) high/low managers profesionals. Note since translation first converts ISCO68 EGP11 applies following logic build EGP11-MP: occupations EGP11 digit 1 ISCO 1-digit 0 1 subordinates, high manager occupations EGP11 digit 1 self-employed 1 employee, high manager occupations EGP11 digit 1 1-digit ISCO higher 1 either employee self-employed subordinates, high professional occupations EGP11 digit 2 ISCO 1-digit 0 1 subordinates, lower manager occupations EGP11 digit 2 self-employed 1 employee, lower manager occupations EGP11 digit 2 1-digit ISCO higher 1 either employee self-employed subordinates, lower professional EGP11 codes remain . translation created Stata file shared Oscar Smallenbroek called "ESEC-MP.". info, please contact author.

title: Translate 3-digit ISCO88COM to ESEC — isco88com_to_esec
text: codification used User's guide suggests contrary full method, uses whether respondent supervisor, self-employed whether person subordinates, simple method matches directly ISCO code ESEC code. info, please see page 17 European Socio-economic Classification (ESeC) User Guide (2006) Rode, D. Harrison, E. translation borrowed iscogen Stata package. info, search 'ISCO-88 -> ESEC' documentation iscogen package. ISCO88, can translate ISCO88COM using function isco88_to_isco88com translating ESEC. function accept 3-digit codes 4 digits. means 3-digit code 131 1310. codes 4 digits, even though code represented 3 digits (1310, 1230, etc..)

title: Translate 3-digit ISCO88COM to ESEC-MP — isco88com_to_esec_mp
text: codification used ESEC user's guide suggests contrary full method, uses whether respondent supervisor, self-employed, employee whether person subordinates, simple method matches directly ISCO code ESEC code. info, please see page 17 European Socio-economic Classification (ESeC) User Guide (2006) Rode, D. Harrison, E. translating ISCO88COM ESEC, logic used build ESEC-MP following: occupations ESEC digit 1 ISCO 1-digit 0 1 subordinates, high manager occupations ESEC digit 1 self-employed 1 employee, high manager occupations ESEC digit 1 1-digit ISCO higher 1 either employee self-employed subordinates, high professional occupations ESEC digit 2 ISCO 1-digit 0 1 subordinates, lower manager occupations ESEC digit 2 self-employed 1 employee, lower manager occupations ESEC digit 2 1-digit ISCO higher 1 either employee self-employed subordinates, lower professional ESEC codes remain . translation created Stata file shared Oscar Smallenbroek called "ESEC-MP.". info, please contact author. function accept 3-digit codes 4 digits. means 3-digit code 131 1310. codes 4 digits, even though code represented 3 digits (1310, 1230, etc..)
